item.text: After Solomon finished building the Lord’s temple, the royal palace, and all the other construction projects he had planned,
the Lord appeared to Solomon a second time, in the same way he had appeared to him at Gibeon.

The Lord said to him, “I have answered your prayer and your request for help that you made to me. I have consecrated this temple you built by making it my permanent home; I will be constantly present there.

<st data-num="0859" class="">You</st> <st data-num="0518" class="">must</st> <st data-num="01980 06440">serve</st> me with <st data-num="08537 03824">integrity</st> and <st data-num="03476" class="">sincerity</st>, just <st data-num="0834" class="">as</st> your <st data-num="01" class="">father</st> <st data-num="01732" class="">David</st> <st data-num="01980" class="">did</st>. <st data-num="06213" class="">Do</st> <st data-num="03605 0834">everything</st> I <st data-num="06680" class="">commanded</st> and <st data-num="08104" class="">obey</st> my <st data-num="02706" class="">rules</st> and <st data-num="04941" class="">regulations</st>.<n id="1" />
Then I will allow your dynasty to rule over Israel permanently, just as I promised your father David, ‘You will not fail to have a successor on the throne of Israel.’
“But if you or your sons ever turn away from me, fail to obey the regulations and rules I instructed you to keep, and decide to serve and worship other gods,

then I will <st data-num="03772" class="">remove</st> <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">from</st> the <st data-num="06440 0127 0834">land</st><n id="1" /> I have <st data-num="05414" class="">given</st> them, I will <st data-num="07971 05921 06440">abandon</st> this <st data-num="01004 0834">temple</st> I have <st data-num="06942" class="">consecrated</st> with my <st data-num="08034" class="">presence</st>,<n id="2" /> and <st data-num="03478" class="">Israel</st> will <st data-num="01961" class="">be</st> <st data-num="04912" class="">mocked</st> and <st data-num="08148" class="">ridiculed</st><n id="3" /> among <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="05971" class="">nations</st>.
This temple will become a heap of ruins; everyone who passes by it will be shocked and will hiss out their scorn, saying, ‘Why did the Lord do this to this land and this temple?’

Others will then answer, ‘Because they abandoned the Lord their God, who led their ancestors out of Egypt. They embraced other gods whom they worshiped and served. That is why the Lord has brought all this disaster down on them.’”
After 20 years, during which Solomon built the Lord’s temple and the royal palace,

<st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> <st data-num="0227 05414">gave</st> <st data-num="04428" class="">King</st> <st data-num="02438" class="">Hiram</st> of <st data-num="06865" class="">Tyre</st><n id="1" /> <st data-num="06242" class="">20</st> <st data-num="05892" class="">towns</st> in the <st data-num="0776" class="">region</st> of <st data-num="01551" class="">Galilee</st>, because <st data-num="02438" class="">Hiram</st> had <st data-num="05375" class="">supplied</st> <st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> <st data-num="06086" class="">with</st> <st data-num="0730" class="">cedars</st>, <st data-num="01265" class="">evergreens</st>, and <st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="02091" class="">gold</st> he <st data-num="02656" class="">wanted</st>.

When <st data-num="02438" class="">Hiram</st> <st data-num="03318" class="">went out</st> from <st data-num="06865" class="">Tyre</st> to <st data-num="07200" class="">inspect</st> the <st data-num="05892 0834">towns</st> <st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> had <st data-num="05414" class="">given</st> him, he was <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="03474 05869">pleased</st> with them.<n id="1" />

Hiram <st data-num="0559" class="">asked</st>,<n id="1" /> “<st data-num="04100" class="">Why</st> did you <st data-num="05414" class="">give</st> me <st data-num="0428" class="">these</st> <st data-num="05892 0834">towns</st>, my <st data-num="0251" class="">friend</st>?”<n id="2" /> He <st data-num="07121" class="">called</st> that area the <st data-num="0776" class="">region</st> of <st data-num="03521" class="">Cabul</st>, a name which it has retained <st data-num="05704" class="">to</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st>.<n id="3" />
Hiram had sent to the king 120 talents of gold.
Here are the details concerning the work crews King Solomon conscripted to build the Lord’s temple, his palace, the terrace, the wall of Jerusalem, and the cities of Hazor, Megiddo, and Gezer.

(<st data-num="06547" class="">Pharaoh</st>, <st data-num="04428" class="">king</st> of <st data-num="04714" class="">Egypt</st>, had <st data-num="05927" class="">attacked</st> and <st data-num="03920" class="">captured</st> <st data-num="01507" class="">Gezer</st>. He <st data-num="08313 0784">burned</st> it and <st data-num="02026" class="">killed</st> the <st data-num="03669" class="">Canaanites</st> who <st data-num="03427" class="">lived</st> in the <st data-num="05892" class="">city</st>. He <st data-num="05414" class="">gave</st> it as a <st data-num="07964" class="">wedding present</st> to his <st data-num="01323" class="">daughter</st>, who had <st data-num="0802" class="">married</st> <st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st>.)

<st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> <st data-num="01129" class="">built up</st> <st data-num="01507" class="">Gezer</st>, <st data-num="08481" class="">lower</st> <st data-num="01032" class="">Beth Horon</st>,
<st data-num="01191" class="">Baalath</st>, <st data-num="08412" class="">Tadmor</st> in the <st data-num="04057 0776">wilderness</st>,<n id="1" />

<st data-num="03605" class="">all</st> the <st data-num="04543" class="">storage</st> <st data-num="05892" class="">cities</st> <st data-num="0834" class="">that</st> <st data-num="01961" class="">belonged</st> to <st data-num="08010" class="">him</st>,<n id="1" /> and the <st data-num="05892" class="">cities</st> where <st data-num="07393" class="">chariots</st> and <st data-num="06571" class="">horses</st> were kept.<n id="2" /> He <st data-num="01129" class="">built</st> <st data-num="02837 0834">whatever</st> <st data-num="08010" class="">he</st> <st data-num="02836" class="">wanted</st> in <st data-num="03389" class="">Jerusalem</st>, <st data-num="03844" class="">Lebanon</st>, and <st data-num="03605" class="">throughout</st> his <st data-num="0776" class="">entire</st> <st data-num="04475" class="">kingdom</st>.<n id="3" />

Now <st data-num="03605" class="">several</st> <st data-num="0834 03808 01121 01992">non</st>-<st data-num="03478" class="">Israelite</st> <st data-num="05971" class="">peoples</st> were <st data-num="03498" class="">left</st> in the land after the conquest of Joshua, <st data-num="04480" class="">including</st> the <st data-num="0567" class="">Amorites</st>, <st data-num="02850" class="">Hittites</st>, <st data-num="06522" class="">Perizzites</st>, <st data-num="02340" class="">Hivites</st>, and <st data-num="02983" class="">Jebusites</st>.<n id="1" />

Their <st data-num="01121 0834">descendants</st> <st data-num="03498 0310">remained</st> in the <st data-num="0776" class="">land</st> (the <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st> <st data-num="0834 03808 03201">were unable</st> to <st data-num="02763" class="">wipe</st> them <st data-num="02763" class="">out completely</st>). <st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> <st data-num="05927" class="">conscripted</st> them for his <st data-num="04522" class="">work crews</st>, and they <st data-num="05647" class="">continue in that role</st> <st data-num="05704" class="">to</st> <st data-num="02088" class="">this</st> very <st data-num="03117" class="">day</st>.<n id="1" />

<st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon</st> did <st data-num="03808" class="">not</st> <st data-num="05414" class="">assign</st> <st data-num="01121 03478">Israelites</st> to <st data-num="05650" class="">these work crews</st>;<n id="1" /> the <st data-num="03588 01992">Israelites</st> served as his <st data-num="0376 04421">soldiers</st>, <st data-num="05650" class="">attendants</st>, <st data-num="08269" class="">officers</st>, <st data-num="07991" class="">charioteers</st>, and <st data-num="08269" class="">commanders</st> of his <st data-num="07393" class="">chariot</st> <st data-num="06571" class="">forces</st>.<n id="2" />

<st data-num="0428" class="">These men</st> were also <st data-num="08269 05324 0834">in charge</st> <st data-num="05921" class="">of</st> <st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon’s</st> <st data-num="04399" class="">work projects</st>; there were a total of <st data-num="02568 03967 02572">550</st> men who <st data-num="07287" class="">supervised</st> the <st data-num="05971 06213 04399">workers</st>.<n id="1" />
Solomon built the terrace as soon as Pharaoh’s daughter moved up from the City of David to the palace Solomon built for her.

Three times a year Solomon offered burnt offerings and peace offerings on the altar he had built for the Lord, burning incense along with them before the Lord. He made the temple his official worship place.
King Solomon also built ships in Ezion Geber, which is located near Elat in the land of Edom, on the shore of the Red Sea.

<st data-num="02438" class="">Hiram</st> <st data-num="07971" class="">sent</st> his <st data-num="0590" class="">fleet</st> and <st data-num="05650" class="">some</st> of his <st data-num="0582 0591">sailors</st>, who were <st data-num="03045" class="">well acquainted with</st> the <st data-num="03220" class="">sea</st>, to serve <st data-num="05973" class="">with</st> <st data-num="08010" class="">Solomon’s</st> <st data-num="05650" class="">men</st>.<n id="1" />
They sailed to Ophir, took from there 420 talents of gold, and then brought them to King Solomon.
